moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 e6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: Main line of the sicilian Pelikan variation
moves.9... Be7: Usually black plays b5 here, threatening b4 with a fork, and aiming to develop with bb7.
moves.10. Nc4: Putting pressure on d6. If black had played 9..b5, this move wouldn't be possible.
moves.10... O-O 11. Bxf6 gxf6: This obviously weakens the king position. Probably better is dropping a pawn, with 11.. Bxf6 12. Qxd6 Be6
moves.12. Ne3: The weaknesses in the black camp are easy to see, and I aim to exploit them. The gaping d5 square is the most obvious focal point.
moves.12... Kh8: Probably better is Be6, with some protection of the d5 square.
moves.17. Qxe7 Bxd5 18. Qxd8+ Rxd8 19. Nxd5 Kg: Black has no winning chances, down a piece and soon to be two pawns. he resigns.
